question: Define multiple inheritance.
answer_new_1: When more than one class acts as base classes for other classes.
answer_new_2: When one class acts as base classes for other classes.
answer_new_3: When more than one class acts as derived classes from one base class.
answer_new_4: When a base class is inherited by multiple derived classes is known as multiple inheritance.

question: What is the correct order for the return value of following error handling functions?
quoted_text:
a. fail() 
b. bad() 
c. good()
answer_new_1: a) returns true when an input or output operation has failed b) returns true if an invalid operation is attempted or any unrecoverable error has occurred c) returns true if no error has occurred.
answer_new_2: a) returns true when an input or output operation has failed b) returns true if no error has occurred c) returns true if an invalid operation is attempted or any unrecoverable error has occurred.
answer_new_3: a) returns true if no error has occurred b) returns true if an invalid operation is attempted or any unrecoverable error has occurred c) returns true when an input or output operation has failed.
answer_new_4: a) returns true when an input or output operation has failed b) returns true if an invalid operation is attempted or any unrecoverable error has occurred c) returns true if error has occurred.

Which is the correct explanation of one to many relationship between classes and their friends
when templates are involved?
answer_new_1:
A non-template function may be a
friend to all template class instantiations.
answer_new_2:
All instantiations of a template
function may be friends to a regular non-template class.
answer_new_3:
All instantiations of a template
function may be a friend to all instantiations of the template class.
answer_new_4:
A template function instantiated with
one set of template arguments may be a friend to one template class instantiated
with the same set of template arguments.
